data.title: Very casual, very good!
data.text:
This was the 3rd lunch trip to Pantanal and the 3rd successful visit.
Really love this place, the mix of offerings would satisfy anyone  especially when in a group with many different tastes. I Think their yellow rice is really far above other places and all the meats  are grilled perfectly. You buy by the pound so your able to pick what you want, There is salad for those who wish that option too. Must try the sausages they are a home run. The only detraction , not the ritziest section of town but it s not to worry and shouldnt keep anyone away. You will be very happy you came

data.title: My absolute favorite in Bridgeport
data.text: Love love love this place.  The churrasco (grilled meat) is excellent - brisket, steak, pork, chicken.  And the fried bananas are a must.  But what I really like is the buffet style, with cold and hot selections.  And they are open late.  It's fast, but it's not fast food.  For $10-12 per person you can eat like a king. Can handle a big group, as they have a big "extra" room in the back.

data.title: Family day out to eat
data.text: When here to eat with the family had a great time food is good especially the meats they are seasoned just right.

data.title: Dinner on the run
data.text: Stopped at a restaurant found on trip Advisor. Never would of found it otherwise. Authentic Brazilian buffet food bought by the pound. Cold and hot buffet. Very nice staff and the flavor was great! Small town corner restaurant obviously very popular because as we sat in the restaurant there was a steady stream of people coming in for take out. Lucky to have found it.

data.title: Always an excellent choice
data.text:
From the moment you park, the smell hits you! This place is one that you will go to again and again. Fresh salad buffet, deliciously seasoned meats, sides, rice, beans - need I say more? If you haven't tried this place, go! Eat in or take out, you will also find incredible desserts and treats. Friendly staff, too!

The Adventures of Butch and Mabel continue...

data.title: Fabulous, cheap food
data.text: Went to Patanal on a Bridgeport culinary expedition with my brother. Excellent food and beer at incredible prices. Limited menu of succulent rotisseried meats and flavorful sides. Frequented by many locals who know the best place to go. Many carry out, but we ate in. Cafeteria style, very casual. Easy place with kids. Wish I lived closer so I could go again.

data.title: Anniversary Lunch with Wife.
data.text:
The Pantanal came highly recommeded by many people, now you can add me to the list. We have enjoyed brazilian bar-b-q in the past. This restaurant does an abundance of take out. The food can be purchased three ways - to go or by the plate for and $7.95-$8.95 per pound, or the way we had it today was $21.95 for all you can eat (90 min. time limit!) We only used 40 minutes! The steak was very good - all the food was good. Samantha was our table server and she was very friendly. What it lacks in atmosphere it makes up for in value and flavor. 

We will be back again and try it by-the-plate -- it would be more than enough. Thanks to all my friends that shared Pantanal with me. Worth a trip when you're in the area.

data.title: wOw~!~ home cooked food and BBQ, restaurant quality, great service at the best price.
data.text:
well, the food is awesome. I have been here too many times to count and I still have not tried it all! by myself, with the kids or with friends, this is my go to spot for a great meal. healthy, fresh and superb value. I like the Brazilian flair, friendly faces and the really good BBQ steak, chicken, sausage, pork and brisket. PLUS, the buffet items are fresh and easy. Salads, 3 types of rice, plantano, pasta, seafood (fried or stewed), potatoes, lasagna, steamed vegetables, more... it just goes on.
  if you want a super alternative to high price spots or fast food take-outs, please try Pantanal in Bridgeport. Like me, you will be glad you did ~!~ do not forget to say hello to Richard, the manager and Joy, the maître de. all the staff is there to help, but these two go the extra mile.
  P.S. the line can be a few minutes at later dinner hours, but they always open up a second check out register to get people seated with their meals quickly. ALSO, the take out is the same great deal; surprise your friend and family and bring home authentic, hand carved steak and meats with delicious and healthy sides. VIVA Pantanal~!~  
jonny b.

data.title: I wrote this on my blog
data.text:
Hey everybody!

 

 
Today we got a good one! On Friday, well, maybe last friday, I went to a utopia in Bridgeport. A local Brazilian Steakhouse!

Now, I did not know what to expect, which made it an even bigger surprise when I walked in. Well, first, let me tell you a story. It was in Mid-February, we had just gotten back from a long skiing trip. I saw that the next country was Brazil, and I immediately wanted to go to a Brazilian Steakhouse! At first I wanted to go to one right across from MoMA, but, with a little help from my mom, I learned what the experience would be like;

"Va! Va! Vere Vrom Brazil! Va! Va!"

"That's not a Brazilian accent. I think that's a Romanian-"

"Listen, you little kid. Either enjoy the experience or get out! I would appreciate the latter!"

So instead, we went to a local Brazilian Steakhouse. Well, first we accidentally to another one. There was practically no one there. When we went in, it went downhill. "Call Me Maybe" was blasting as a blurry flatscreen TV showed Brazilian SportsCenter (Yes, that's a thing). And, the closest thing to steak was a chicken stew. So we left.

We then found the right Brazilian Steakhouse, WHICH WAS A BLOCK AWAY! I mean, really? Anyways, as soon as we got out of the car, we smelled the amazing smell of BBQ. I knew that this was the right place. The place was buzzing, people ordering food, playing pool, and having a good time. We got a plate and moved down the large buffet, getting some rice, to the meat guy.

He took a mouthwatering slice of meat of a kebab and chopped it into perfect pieces. We got a beverage, paid, and sat down. Here is what was on my plate, I am not exaggerating.

The steak was great, the rice was a nice add on, and this is proof that you can't mess up sausage. It was as good, if not better, than the cevapi. Yes, this place was great. But that's not all. I got tres leches cake while my dad got a corn pudding. All of us thought the desserts were delicious, including Will, who got a Reese's Peanut Butter Cup, but with ice cream in the middle.

Overall, this restaurant was great, I recommend you go there! That's all I have to say! Bye!

data.title: Superv A++ !!!
data.text:
Great place to watch a game and dine on amazing Brazilian food. excellent service.
Good amount of tables you will always find a place to sit right away. A lot of good choices  a vegans also...!!!

data.title: Best Steak in town!!!!!!
data.text: you can order medium or well done. well done is my favorite. along with rice and a large cup of natural guava juice.

data.title: Delicious!
data.text: Excellent food, exceptional meat! Everything is very fresh. Definitely try their steak and deserts. They also sell raw meat for the bbq!

data.title: Buffet & desserts are great
data.text: Great buffet choices and the meat was delicious... Sausage, chicken wings, chicken wrapped in bacon, steak and more. They also have desserts that are amazing. Flan, pave, pudim and more. You can take out or eat in. Quick and friendly service!

data.title: Good family restaurant
data.text: I've taken my family here a few times. This is a good buffet style restaurant and you weigh your plate. It is fairly inexpensive and the food is fresh.

data.title: "The Best Brazilian Buffet in Bpt"
data.text: This is the best brazilian food around.Try there Sirloin or leg of lamb the best.Great choices in buffet just like back home cooking.Great service.THE BEST IN BPT!!

data.title: Great Food
data.text: I love this place. I go quite often and enjoy the chicken breast wrapped in bacon, sweet plantains and rice with beans. The people that work there are very kind and attentive. Great Buffet and Great price by the pound.

data.title: Another Brazilian Buffet
data.text:
Another Brazilian Buffet - lots of them around Bridgeport- 
can be fun but if you have had the real thing in Brazil it is hard to compare to that.

data.title: Still the best Brazilian food in Bridgeport
data.text:
I have ben eating here for a number of years and through a few different owners and have to say it has gotten really good again after a bit of a quality hiatus. Best Brazial bar b que beef around, nice and salty and lean. The buffet is ample and features a good cross section of Brazilian standards. They serve beer, too but unfortunately no Brahma chop which apparently is no longer available in CT. 
Not easy to find, but in a safe neighborhood and always filled with locals and Bridgeport cops who know a good meal . Where else can you buy your dinner by weight?
Great place.

data.title: Really delicous and fresh tasting food! Great hot and cold buffet
data.text:
I visited this restaurant last weekend with some family and friends and we all loved it! 

There is a super hot and cold buffet with lots of selections. My favorite was the plantains and rice- yummy. Also available is chicken wrapped in bacon and it is out of this world, the chicken is super tender and had great flavor. There is plenty to select from even for vegetarians.

Make sure to save room for desserts. I had the flan and it was the best I ever had. 

Try Pantanel, it is 2 minutes off the highway and easy directions are found on their website

data.title: COMIDA BEM BRASILEIRA !!
data.text: Restaurante Self Service Com um Buffet bem variado e carnes de boa qualidade. Bom Atendimento e Ambiente Familiar com estacionamento.
